justification: Under Group-matching measures the authors note that “Participants … complet[ed] the Toronto Alexithymia Scale (TAS; Bagby, Taylor, & Parker, 1994)” indicating the scale is the instrument used to measure alexithymia.

The Methods section states that participants completed “the Matrix Reasoning Item bank (MaRs-IB; Chierchia et al., 2019), a measure of non-verbal reasoning (NVR) lasting 8 minutes,” linking this reasoning construct to the MaRs-IB instrument.

The text explains that “The Autism Quotient (AQ; Baron-Cohen et al., 2006) was also completed to ensure that the autistic group were higher on autistic traits,” directly pairing autistic traits with the AQ measure.

measured_by: Point-light facial‐expression task by Sowden et al.
justification: In describing additional tests, the authors write that “Participants also completed an additional test of social cognition (Sowden, Schuster, Fraser, Keating, & Cook, in press) which enabled us to evidence a distinction between social and non-social influence,” indicating this task operationalises social-cognitive ability.

measured_by: Risky decision-making task adapted from Michael et al. (2019)
justification: The Procedure section states, “The risky decision-making task was adapted from Michael et al. (2019),” and the study’s primary analyses use indices derived from this task, showing it is the instrument for measuring risky decision-making.
